title: Luden's costs more and is less stat efficient than Duskblade and Shiv, yet deals less damage
body:
Luden's deals 100 damage with a negligible AP scaling, while Duskblade and Shiv do up to 360-400 damage. How is this fair when Luden's costs more and is less gold efficient? I guess you could argue that it is magic damage, but so is Shiv and Duskblade users will usually have a ton of flat penetration anyway.

EDIT: Just to clarify, I don't think Luden's needs to be buffed (significantly atleast), I think Duskblade and Shiv are way too strong.

no, anivia can only compare to a marksman under extensive circumstances 

the current marksman average is 500 per second(or more)

if we average her abilities and their damages(for her to somehow have "dps")  it comes to

her ultimate dealing 80 + 12.5% AP and then 160 + 25% AP after 1.5 seconds;
her Q is 160 + 0.4 AP per hit
her E is 150 + 0.5 AP/300 + 1.0AP situational

at current optimal rates of about 600 AP, if you break it down into dps, it comes to

Q = 8s cd
e = 4x cd
ult = additional dps

basically, her highest dps is [(320 + (600 x 0.8) + 300 + 600) / (12 / 2)   ] +  160 + 150

this comes to about 593 dps maximum magic damage.  The burst damage might be higher initially, but when you then factor in magic resistance, the result drops significantly

you also have to take into account that these numbers only happen if anivia can get and stay within a range of 750 for her ultimate and 650 for her E, also requiring that her E and Q be both optimal hits, also requiring that she not be crowd controlled(which disrupts her ultimate)

you then also have to account for that these numbers only happen if anivia reaches a full 6-item build

Anivia only has 1/5th greater dps than a marksman **IF SHE MANAGES EVERYTHING TO THE OPTIMAL EXTENT WITH A FULL BUILD** and the opponent has **NO MAGIC RESISTANCE**

factor in the new shield and heals meta and suddenly her burst damage drops to near zero, which in turn drops her dps constantly as well

to sum things up...in a real-game scenario, she will probably only do half of what her optimal dps is or less simply because of magic resistance and the grind time to full potential

she is still a ranged threat with her Q, but ultimately, her burst damage is on the low side for poke damage (with only one poke ability on a long cooldown in most scenarios)

these numbers get way different with cooldown reduction, but cooldown reduction also tends to reduce your total AP and mana/sustain

Someone else mentioned that a large part of the reason AP items are less stat efficient is because {{item:3089}}  exists. Honestly, if the Deathcap's passive was reduced to 25% and all other AP items (and Deathcap's cost) were modified accordingly, I feel like AP items would be much more balanced. As it stands, they must all be made with the assumption that they'll be given an extra 35% AP due to the Deathcap, meaning with full items the Deathcap is _very_ gold efficient. If the items were rebalanced around a nerfed Deathcap passive and reduced cost, I feel like we could start seeing some positive changes to AP items in general.
